channel.title: Writings on beach road fried toad
channel.description: Recent content in Writings on beach road fried toad

item.title: USA Tour Via Movies
item.description: Since November 2022, Sarah and I have been on a trip around the US through movies – in alphabetical order. It’s taking a while but here is the list so far: Alabama - Big Fish Watched 12/2022 Rating Ian: 7/10 Sarah: 6/10 Alaska - Big Miracle Watched 17/12/2022 Rating Ian: 8/10 Sarah: 7/10 Arizona - Pump Up The Volume Watched 26/12/2022 Rating Ian: 4/10 Sarah: 3/10 Arkansas - Mud Watched 11/02/2023

item.title: 20251115 • Garden Update
item.description: Here is where the garden is at half–way through November… Spinach grew from direct sow. Spring onions to the left are very slow but haven’t died. 2 Apollo tomatoes and a yellow one on the far left. Rocket has shot up from seed. Another batch on the way. Calendula taking up a lot of space at the front but has some flowers for Winnie. There is also a chilli in there, maybe that will grow in the warmer weather coming.

item.title: North2South Trip 25
item.description: Day one – load the bikes and stop at Latrobe. Reliquaire. Bakery. Bike track. Get to the Ulvy airbnb. Watch the GF. Eat Andycooks chips. After going to The Hive, arrive in Campbell Town for our favourite accommodation of the trip. Discovered our new favourite family game: Sushi Go. A wet day of driving to get to Kingston Beach. Stopping in Hobart for the pool and two of our (Sarah and my) favourite shops; State Cinema Book Shop and Area 52.

item.title: Treats of Tasmania
item.description: A post dedicated to the treats of Tassie. Will add more as I find them. 1. Scottsdale Cottage Bakery Ask for an egg roll – warmed in the microwave with butter and relish. $3.50. Chef’s kiss. 2. Chilla’s Takeaway Devonport Breakfast wrap. Egg, bacon, hashbrown, cheese, BBQ sauce. 3. Latrobe Bakery Egg & bacon roll. $2.80 each. 4. Detention River Store Sweet Chilli, Cheese and Bacon, Chicken Schnitzel Roll. $10.80. Crazy invention.

item.title: March Long Weekend 25 • Bakers Beach
item.description: A friday evening escape with the pod to Bakers Beach/Narawntpu. Pulled in at about 6:30pm and managed to get a spot. Buddies. Slamwich and Monopoly Deal in the pod. Walter bonding with his new friend ‘Bushy’. Lunch at the Blue Berry Barn Cafe on the way home.

item.title: Australia Day 2025 • Hawley, Wilmot + Beach Road
item.description: The public holiday after a Sunday Australia Day. A rainy but warm visit to Hawley Beach. A visit to Brock’s new house in Wilmot. And home for some Slip’n’Slide.

item.title: King Island • January 2025
item.description: First week – straight back into it. The best weather I’ve had on King. Beach road from the skies.

item.title: 20241223 Christmas Eveve
item.description: Taking my new camera, Sony ZV1F for a spin. So good to have a camera with a flip-out screen again.

item.title: brft.xyz: The Playlist
item.description: This is the soundtrack to brft.xyz Songs for future videos. Songs that capture the vibe. Golden hour. Nostalgia. Warmth.

item.title: Hawley Video ARCHIVE
item.description: A video from 2020. A quick trip to Hawley on my first summer break as an electrical apprentice. One of my favourite sleepy fish tracks on this one. One of my favourite videos I’ve made.

item.title: Coles Bay July 24 Video
item.description: We got away on one of the frostiest weekends of the year to Coles Bay. Shot with the Sigma 35mm 1.4 and ran through the 8mm app.

item.title: Work Derby Getaway Video
item.description: Around a week ago I returned from my work’s annual getaway. This year staying at the boss’ accommodation in Derby. I took the camera to make a quick video for socials. Was fun to have a go at shooting mountain biking. I’m finding my new Sigma 35mm f1.4 is perfect for this kind of video.

item.title: November Sprinkler • Sigma 35mm f1.4
item.description: A warm Saturday in November. Some shots on my new Sigma 35mm f1.4 on my a7sIII.

item.title: Arm River Track Hike
item.description: Last weekend Dad and I hiked to Pelion Hut via the Arm River Track. The weather was forecast to be overcast and light showers for all 3 days – but I have never had such great weather up in the highlands. Max of 13-14 degs and almost no wind. On the Friday we walked in via the Arm River Track, about a 10-11km walk in the end. We eventually found a camp spot just outside Pelion Hut.

item.title: Northdown Beach Video
item.description: I installed the latest firmware udpate to my Sony a7iii (with much difficulty) to get the new intervalometer feature. Using it to try out a new video format idea I have had. Put simply, a series of timelapse sequences - all from the same scene. But the timelapses are short interval, around 1 second, longer than your average burst mode yet short enough to cover 10-20 seconds of action. Combining the nostalgic quality of photos and the immersive effect of video.

item.title: About this page
item.description: Beach Road Fried Toad. This is my corner of the internet. A place which isn’t social media to leave whatever I have been working on or doing, in a format which lends itself to archive more than attention. Video, photo, family, home, travels, food, music, projects – anything really. Minimal text, minimal fluff. Some kind of diary, some kind of blog. by easy.
